{{also|Nichts}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|niht}}.{{R:Kluge 1891‎|nichts}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|nix}} {{qualifier|a very common colloquial pronunciation; frequently seen in informal writing}} * {{l|de|nischt}} {{qualifier|dialectal, widely restricted to eastern Germany}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/nɪçts/|/nixts/}} * {{audio|de|De-nichts.ogg|Audio}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun|indefinite pronoun|g=n}} # [[nothing]] #: ''Ich weiß, dass ich '''nichts''' weiß.'' #:: I know that I know '''nothing'''. ====Declension==== Invariable. A following adjective is capitalized and declined as a neuter singular in the strong pattern. Thus ''nichts Neu'''es''''' (“nothing new”) in the nominative and accusative cases; ''nichts Neu'''em''''' in the dative case. A genitive form does not exist. It is paraphrased by means of the preposition {{m|de|von||of}}. After the prepositions {{m|de|statt}}, {{m|de|trotz}}, {{m|de|während}}, and {{m|de|wegen}}, the dative case is used instead: ''wegen nichts Wichtig'''em''''' – “because of nothing important” (i.e. because of something unimportant). ===References=== ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Scots== ===Noun=== {{head|sco|noun plural form}} # {{plural of|sco|nicht}}
